intro: Dimerostemma brasiliana, commonly known as the Brazilian star vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dimerostemma brasiliana is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
